page.title: 01DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: {INTRODUCTION TO DOWNDERRY/SEATON The area described is predominantly agricultural,with a pair of small twin coastal villages.Curiously many of the facilities necessary to village life are situated in a more southerly 'D block' described elsewhere under the Grid Ref. 02280051. The villages have developed since 1850 on the coastal fields of the many small farms.The catalyst to development was the advent of Brunel's railway into Cornwall with the station at St.Germans,accessible by horse and carriage.The later introduction of the motorcar allowed this area to become a seaside holiday venue,a retirement centre and a dormitory site for the connurbation of Plymouth and the towns of East Cornwall especially Torpoint and Liskeard.
